description: Copied A.H. 1105 [A.D. 1693] by Aḥmad ibn Sulaymān al-Aḥsāʼī. Fols. 250; 24 x 17.5 cm.; written surface 17.5 x 12.3 cm.; 26-28 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; headings, entries and rubrications in red. A well-known biographical dictionary of eminent lexicographers and grammarians. Beg.: بسم الله الرحمن الرحىم ... الحمد لله خالق الجود Colophon: وکان الفراغ من کتابتها بعد صلاة العصر من ىوم الخمىس ثامن شهر محرم الحرام ابتداء سنة 1105 خمس بعد المائة الالف من الهجرة النبوىة على صاحبها افضل الصلاة وازکى السلام وعلى اله وصحبه اجمعىن Marginal notes and glosses; marginal summaries. In the introduction the author states that this work is a redaction from a larger work of his which he composed in seven volumes but never published. Before the colophon the author states that this book was composed A.H. 871 [A.D. 1467]. MS in fair condition but worm-eaten; Arabic leather binding with flap; blind stamped and tooling on cover and flap. Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1900. Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), IV, pp. 153/4; Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻArabīyah al-maḥfūẓah bi-al-Kutubkhānah al-Khudaywīyah, V, p. 19; Rieu, Supplement of the catalogue of the Arabic Mss, 649; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 10062; Die arabischen, persischen und türkischen handschriften der Kaiserlich-königlichen hofbibliothik zu Wien, 1175; Browne, Hand-list of the Muḥammadan manuscripts, 137. Printed in Cairo, A.H. 1326.
author: Suyūṭī, 1445-1505

title.@value: بغىة الوعاة في طبقات اللغوىىن والنحاة.
Bughyat al-wuʻāh fī ṭabaqāt al-lughawīyīn wa-al-nuḥāh.
